networkDesc:
SDSN Western Balkans is a regional community of universities, research centers, and knowledge institutions. It is developed as a network for regional countries in cooperation with SDSN Greece and SDSN Europe as a helpful tool for applying SDG and Agenda 2030. Our network aims to teach sustainable development, support solution initiatives, and localize the SDGs in Western Balkan countries.

We engage with academia, scientists, researchers, business and civil society leaders, and development practitioners for evidence-based problem-solving.
networkVisionSubtitle: Agenda 2030 and the SDGs are perceived as mutually reinforcing and complimentary processes that encourage institutions and citizens to strive for a better society and a future where no one is left behind and where people, prosperity, peace, partnership, and care for our planet are at the core of a better and common future. Project resonates deeply with the principle of ‘no one left behind’ in Agenda 2030. This continues to be an important principle for the diverse populations Western Balkans struggling to define a political and social order that respects the identity groups present in a governance and social architecture coherent with the requirements for European integration. 2 Agenda 2030 offers an opportunity to build a consensus vision for social development in the region with full respect for the inclusion of distinct identities.

networkObjectives.header: Improve the framework that governments and all shareholders could use to make progress in achieving the SDGs.
Strengthen the capacity of all relevant institutions for the implementation of the SDGs at the state level
To provide support for the implementation of the Agenda 2030
